c74object.name: bach.keys
c74object.digest: Route an llll according to specific keys
c74object.description: Routes an llll and its sublists according to specific keys.

outlet.digest: Found match for the corresponding key
bang if no match is found

method.name: bang
method.description: The keys are searched for in the most recently received llll.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Search the llll for the specified keys
method.description:
The first elements of the llll and all its sublists are examined, traversing the llll depth-first as in bach.iter. When a first element is found to match one of bach.keys's arguments (the "keys"), the corresponding llll is output, with or without the key according to the keep attribute, and that key is no further looked for.
Anyway, all the found lllls are output right-to-left, according to their order in bach.keys's arguments and regardless of their positions in the original llll. In case of multiple possible matches, the first matching llll that is found is output. If no match is found for any key, a bang is output from the rightmost outlet.

attribute.name: depthreject
attribute.description: When set to 1, the search depth range set through the mindepth and maxdepth attributes is inverted, meaning that the specified depth range is excluded from the search, rather than included.

attribute.name: keep
attribute.description: When set to 1, the key for each output llll is not removed.

attribute.name: maxdepth
attribute.description: maxdepth sets the maximum depth level at which the operation must be performed. If negative, the depth level is counted from the innermost level of each branch of the tree. A value of 0 is not accepted. Defaults to -1, i.e. there is no limitation (stop at the innermost level).

attribute.name: mindepth
attribute.description: mindepth sets the minimum depth level at which the operation must be performed. If negative, the depth level is counted from the innermost level of each branch of the tree. A value of 0 is not accepted. Defaults to 1, i.e. there is no limitation.

attribute.name: nullmode
attribute.description: When set to 1, if no match was found for a given key null is output from the corresponding outlet.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

c74object.discussion: The usefulness of bach.keys is twofold: it allows treating an llll as an associative array, and it allows routing lllls based upon their first elements. It is very commonly used in conjunction with bach.score and bach.roll's slots, as well as in bach.constraint's lambda loop.

entry.name: Outlets 1, 2, 3... (llll)
entry.description: Found match for the corresponding key.

entry.name: The last Outlet (bang)
entry.description: bang if no match is found.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: The usefulness of bach.keys is twofold: it allows treating an llll as an associative array, and it allows routing lllls based upon their first elements. It is very commonly used in conjunction with bach.score and bach.roll's slots, as well as in bach.constraint's lambda loop.

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: key, router, route, sublist, element, retrieve.
